item.title: 【Albums (lossless)】DTSHD - The Flaming Lips 4 Surround Sound Albums - 5.1 96khz 24bit DTSHD Sourced from DVDA and 5.1 DD DVD Video
item.description:
Many years ago when i first got into surround sound music and was searching for "Official / Original" content i came across the flaming lips through their surround sound DVD Audio discs. Then i became a fan of the band as they make amazing music. I collected the DVD Audio discs then extracted the audio from them and converted the lossless audio to DTS-HD to save space and encapsulate in format suitable for blu ray then made AVCHD blu rays to play them on my home theater through my ps3 at the time.

After seeing the Dolby Atmos Release of Yoshimi the other day it inspired me to make rips from my old AVCHD files. Maybe some day i will upload the AVCHD's as they are pretty neat. I took the video from the dvd video releases of the surround sound albums and merged it with the lossless audio (the DVDV only had loss DD and DTS audio) and also included the music videos from the DVDV and made menus in i think nero blu ray creator... This is back is 2010 or maybe earlier. Maybe the original files are still kicking on the internet? i released them under the release group banner PS3AVCHD. I believe i was into usenet primarily at the time so thats how i would have shared them.

At any rate for your listening pleasure i present 3 flaming lips albums in lossless 5.1 96khz 24bit surround sound:

Yoshimi Battles the Pink Robots
At War With The Mystics
The Soft Bulletin

And 1 flaming lips album as i came across it in dvd video (i spent a bit of time looking at converting it myself, but after a few hours spent on the first 3 albums which i was already familiar with how to process i gave up for today, the Zaireeka DVD looks a lot more complicated with numerous audio tracks.. I suspect due in part to how it was made:

Zaireeka - The album consists of four CDs designed so that when played simultaneously on four separate audio systems, they would produce a harmonic or juxtaposed sound; the discs could also be played in different combinations, omitting one, two or three discs. Each of its eight songs consists of four stereo tracks, one from each CD.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Flaming Lips - Yoshimi Battles the Pink Robots
Released: July 16, 2002
Genre: Dream pop, Space rock, Acid rock, Neo-psychedelia
Format / Quality: m4a / 5.1 DTS-HD 96khz 24bit - Sourced from DVD Audio

item.title: 【Albums (lossy)】Dolby Atmos - Jean-Michel Jarre - OXYMORE (Homage to Pierre Henry) [E-AC3 JOC | 16-bit 48 kHz | 5.1 | 768 kb/s]
item.description:
Genre: Electronic
Style: Techno
Year: 2022
Source: Apple Music, with help of SonMaxime

"OXYMORE" is the twenty-second studio album by French musician and composer Jean-Michel Jarre. It was released on 21 October 2022 through Sony and Columbia.

Originally, Jarre was planning a collaboration with the French composer Pierre Henry, one of Jarre's influences, but Henry died in 2017 and the collaboration was never completed. Henry had however recorded some sound bites for the collaboration, which Jarre used for the album. Jarre then added his own compositions on top.
Jarre stated: "I chose some of his sounds precisely from one track to another. 'Oxymore' is also a tribute to the French way of approaching modern music, electroacoustic music, and my early studies at the GRM where Pierre definitely influenced the future of electronic music worldwide, along with Pierre Schaeffer."

Jarre stated that the true sound is not stereo but can be heard in 360 degrees. He also stated that the album can be best heard with headphones or more advanced audio systems. Oxymore was released on CD, double vinyl and digital in stereo, binaural, 5.1 and Dolby Atmos mixes. The physical product also includes a code to access the highest quality binaural master. You can download the Hi-Res Binaural mix here (FLAC 24-bit 48 kHz).

Tracklist
01. AGORA 01:34
02. OXYMORE 04:45
03. NEON LIPS 04:27
04. SONIC LAND 06:01
05. ANIMAL GENESIS 05:46
06. SYNTHY SISTERS 03:20
07. SEX IN THE MACHINE 05:45
08. ZEITGEIST 03:06
09. CRYSTAL GARDEN 04:09
10. BRUTALISM 04:41
11. EPICA 05:25

Note to the peeps @ RuTracker: Give credit if you post the work of someone else!
- Hurby4 aka ADHDerby
